name: chrome.accessibilityFeatures
comment: Use the chrome.accessibilityFeatures API to manage Chrome's accessibility features. This API relies on the ChromeSetting prototype of the type API for getting and setting individual accessibility features. In order to get feature states the extension must request accessibilityFeatures.read permission. For modifying feature state, the extension needs accessibilityFeatures.modify permission. Note that accessibilityFeatures.modify does not imply accessibilityFeatures.read permission.

properties.comment: get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: animationPolicy

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Auto mouse click after mouse stops moving. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: autoclick

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Caret highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: caretHighlight

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Cursor color. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not, doesn't indicate the color of it. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: cursorColor

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Cursor highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: cursorHighlight

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Docked magnifier. The value indicates whether docked magnifier feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: dockedMagnifier

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Focus highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: focusHighlight

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

High contrast rendering mode. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: highContrast

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Enlarged cursor. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: largeCursor

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Full screen magnification. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: screenMagnifier

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Select-to-speak. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: selectToSpeak

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Spoken feedback (text-to-speech). The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: spokenFeedback

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Sticky modifier keys (like shift or alt). The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: stickyKeys

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Switch Access. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: switchAccess

properties.comment:
ChromeOS only.

Virtual on-screen keyboard. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.
properties.name: virtualKeyboard

name: chrome.action
comment: Use the chrome.action API to control the extension's icon in the Google Chrome toolbar.

properties.comment: The ID of the tab to query state for. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific state is returned.
properties.name: tabId

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.comment: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the action.

methods.comment: Disables the action for a tab.
methods.name: disable

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.comment: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the action.

methods.comment: Enables the action for a tab. By default, actions are enabled.
methods.name: enable

methods.comment: Gets the background color of the action.
methods.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor

methods.comment: Gets the badge text of the action. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge text is returned. If displayActionCountAsBadgeText is enabled, a placeholder text will be returned unless the declarativeNetRequestFeedback permission is present or tab-specific badge text was provided.
methods.name: getBadgeText

methods.comment: Gets the html document set as the popup for this action.
methods.name: getPopup

methods.comment: Gets the title of the action.
methods.name: getTitle

properties.comment: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00.
properties.name: color

properties.comment: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.
properties.name: tabId

methods.comment: Sets the background color for the badge.
methods.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor

properties.comment: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.
properties.name: tabId

properties.comment: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.
properties.name: text

methods.comment: Sets the badge text for the action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.
methods.name: setBadgeText

properties.comment: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'
properties.name: imageData

properties.comment: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'
properties.name: path

properties.comment: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.
properties.name: tabId

methods.comment: Sets the icon for the action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.
methods.name: setIcon

properties.comment: The html file to show in a popup. If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.
properties.name: popup

properties.comment: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.
properties.name: tabId

methods.comment: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the action's icon.
methods.name: setPopup

properties.comment: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.
properties.name: tabId

properties.comment: The string the action should display when moused over.
properties.name: title

methods.comment: Sets the title of the action. This shows up in the tooltip.
methods.name: setTitle

events.comment: Fired when an action icon is clicked. This event will not fire if the action has a popup.
events.name: onClicked

name: chrome.alarms
comment: Use the chrome.alarms API to schedule code to run periodically or at a specified time in the future.

properties.comment: Name of this alarm.
properties.name: name

properties.comment: If not null, the alarm is a repeating alarm and will fire again in periodInMinutes minutes.
properties.name: periodInMinutes

properties.comment: Time at which this alarm was scheduled to fire, in milliseconds past the epoch (e.g. Date.now() + n). For performance reasons, the alarm may have been delayed an arbitrary amount beyond this.
properties.name: scheduledTime

properties.comment: Length of time in minutes after which the onAlarm event should fire.
properties.name: delayInMinutes

properties.comment: If set, the onAlarm event should fire every periodInMinutes minutes after the initial event specified by when or delayInMinutes. If not set, the alarm will only fire once.
properties.name: periodInMinutes

properties.comment: Time at which the alarm should fire, in milliseconds past the epoch (e.g. Date.now() + n).
properties.name: when

parameters.name: name
parameters.comment: The name of the alarm to clear. Defaults to the empty string.

methods.comment: Clears the alarm with the given name.
methods.name: clear

methods.comment: Clears all alarms.
methods.name: clearAll

parameters.name: name
parameters.comment: Optional name to identify this alarm. Defaults to the empty string.

parameters.name: alarmInfo
parameters.comment: Describes when the alarm should fire. The initial time must be specified by either when or delayInMinutes (but not both). If periodInMinutes is set, the alarm will repeat every periodInMinutes minutes after the initial event. If neither when or delayInMinutes is set for a repeating alarm, periodInMinutes is used as the default for delayInMinutes.

methods.comment:
Creates an alarm. Near the time(s) specified by alarmInfo, the onAlarm event is fired. If there is another alarm with the same name (or no name if none is specified), it will be cancelled and replaced by this alarm.

In order to reduce the load on the user's machine, Chrome limits alarms to at most once every 1 minute but may delay them an arbitrary amount more. That is, setting delayInMinutes or periodInMinutes to less than 1 will not be honored and will cause a warning. when can be set to less than 1 minute after "now" without warning but won't actually cause the alarm to fire for at least 1 minute.

To help you debug your app or extension, when you've loaded it unpacked, there's no limit to how often the alarm can fire.
methods.name: create

parameters.name: name
parameters.comment: The name of the alarm to get. Defaults to the empty string.

methods.comment: Retrieves details about the specified alarm.
methods.name: get

methods.comment: Gets an array of all the alarms.
methods.name: getAll

parameters.name: alarm
parameters.comment: The alarm that has elapsed.

events.comment: Fired when an alarm has elapsed. Useful for event pages.
events.name: onAlarm

name: chrome.app.runtime
comment: Use the chrome.app.runtime API to manage the app lifecycle. The app runtime manages app installation, controls the event page, and can shut down the app at anytime.

properties.comment: Allows embedderId to embed this app in an <appview> element. The url specifies the content to embed.
properties.name: allow

properties.comment: Optional developer specified data that the app to be embedded can use when making an embedding decision.
properties.name: data

properties.comment: Prevents embedderId from embedding this app in an <appview> element.
properties.name: deny

properties.comment: Contains data that specifies the ActionType this app was launched with. This is null if the app was not launched with a specific action intent.
properties.name: actionData

properties.comment: The ID of the file or URL handler that the app is being invoked with. Handler IDs are the top-level keys in the file_handlers and/or url_handlers dictionaries in the manifest.
properties.name: id

properties.comment: Whether the app is being launched in a Chrome OS kiosk session.
properties.name: isKioskSession

properties.comment: Whether the app is being launched in a Chrome OS public session.
properties.name: isPublicSession

properties.comment: The file entries for the onLaunched event triggered by a matching file handler in the file_handlers manifest key.
properties.name: items

properties.comment: The referrer URL for the onLaunched event triggered by a matching URL handler in the url_handlers manifest key.
properties.name: referrerUrl

properties.comment: Where the app is launched from.
properties.name: source

properties.comment: The URL for the onLaunched event triggered by a matching URL handler in the url_handlers manifest key.
properties.name: url

properties.comment: Entry for the item.
properties.name: entry

properties.comment: The MIME type of the file.
properties.name: type

types.comment: An app can be launched with a specific action in mind, for example, to create a new note. The type of action the app was launched with is available inside of the |actionData| field from the LaunchData instance.
types.name: ActionType

types.comment: Enumeration of app launch sources. This should be kept in sync with AppLaunchSource in components/services/app_service/public/mojom/types.mojom, and GetLaunchSourceEnum() in extensions/browser/api/app_runtime/app_runtime_api.cc. Note the enumeration is used in UMA histogram so entries should not be re-ordered or removed.
types.name: LaunchSource

events.comment: Fired when an embedding app requests to embed this app. This event is only available on dev channel with the flag --enable-app-view.
events.name: onEmbedRequested

events.comment: Fired when an app is launched from the launcher.
events.name: onLaunched

events.comment: Fired at Chrome startup to apps that were running when Chrome last shut down, or when apps have been requested to restart from their previous state for other reasons (e.g. when the user revokes access to an app's retained files the runtime will restart the app). In these situations if apps do not have an onRestarted handler they will be sent an onLaunched event instead.
events.name: onRestarted

name: chrome.app.window
comment: Use the chrome.app.window API to create windows. Windows have an optional frame with title bar and size controls. They are not associated with any Chrome browser windows. See the Window State Sample for a demonstration of these options.

properties.comment: Clear attention to the window.
properties.name: clearAttention

properties.comment: Close the window.
properties.name: close

properties.comment: The JavaScript 'window' object for the created child.
properties.name: contentWindow

properties.comment: Draw attention to the window.
properties.name: drawAttention

properties.comment: Focus the window.
properties.name: focus

properties.comment:
Fullscreens the window.

The user will be able to restore the window by pressing ESC. An application can prevent the fullscreen state to be left when ESC is pressed by requesting the app.window.fullscreen.overrideEsc permission and canceling the event by calling .preventDefault(), in the keydown and keyup handlers, like this:

window.onkeydown = window.onkeyup = function(e) { if (e.keyCode == 27 /* ESC */) { e.preventDefault(); } };

Note window.fullscreen() will cause the entire window to become fullscreen and does not require a user gesture. The HTML5 fullscreen API can also be used to enter fullscreen mode (see Web APIs for more details).
properties.name: fullscreen

properties.comment: Get the window's inner bounds as a ContentBounds object.
properties.name: getBounds

properties.comment: Hide the window. Does nothing if the window is already hidden.
properties.name: hide

properties.comment: The id the window was created with.
properties.name: id

properties.comment: The position, size and constraints of the window's content, which does not include window decorations. This property is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: innerBounds

properties.comment: Is the window always on top?
properties.name: isAlwaysOnTop

properties.comment: Is the window fullscreen? This will be true if the window has been created fullscreen or was made fullscreen via the AppWindow or HTML5 fullscreen APIs.
properties.name: isFullscreen

properties.comment: Is the window maximized?
properties.name: isMaximized

properties.comment: Is the window minimized?
properties.name: isMinimized

properties.comment: Maximize the window.
properties.name: maximize

properties.comment: Minimize the window.
properties.name: minimize

properties.comment: Move the window to the position (|left|, |top|).
properties.name: moveTo

properties.comment: The position, size and constraints of the window, which includes window decorations, such as the title bar and frame. This property is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: outerBounds

properties.comment: Resize the window to |width|x|height| pixels in size.
properties.name: resizeTo

properties.comment: Restore the window, exiting a maximized, minimized, or fullscreen state.
properties.name: restore

properties.comment: Set whether the window should stay above most other windows. Requires the alwaysOnTopWindows permission.
properties.name: setAlwaysOnTop

properties.comment: Set the window's inner bounds.
properties.name: setBounds

properties.comment: Set whether the window is visible on all workspaces. (Only for platforms that support this).
properties.name: setVisibleOnAllWorkspaces

properties.comment: Show the window. Does nothing if the window is already visible. Focus the window if |focused| is set to true or omitted.
properties.name: show

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current height of the content or window.
properties.name: height

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current X coordinate of the content or window.
properties.name: left

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current maximum height of the content or window. A value of null indicates 'unspecified'.
properties.name: maxHeight

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current maximum width of the content or window. A value of null indicates 'unspecified'.
properties.name: maxWidth

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current minimum height of the content or window. A value of null indicates 'unspecified'.
properties.name: minHeight

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current minimum width of the content or window. A value of null indicates 'unspecified'.
properties.name: minWidth

properties.comment: Set the maximum size constraints of the content or window. The maximum width or height can be set to null to remove the constraint. A value of undefined will leave a constraint unchanged.
properties.name: setMaximumSize

properties.comment: Set the minimum size constraints of the content or window. The minimum width or height can be set to null to remove the constraint. A value of undefined will leave a constraint unchanged.
properties.name: setMinimumSize

properties.comment: Set the left and top position of the content or window.
properties.name: setPosition

properties.comment: Set the width and height of the content or window.
properties.name: setSize

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current Y coordinate of the content or window.
properties.name: top

properties.comment: This property can be used to read or write the current width of the content or window.
properties.name: width

properties.comment: The height of the content or window.
properties.name: height

properties.comment: The X coordinate of the content or window.
properties.name: left

properties.comment: The maximum height of the content or window.
properties.name: maxHeight

properties.comment: The maximum width of the content or window.
properties.name: maxWidth

properties.comment: The minimum height of the content or window.
properties.name: minHeight

properties.comment: The minimum width of the content or window.
properties.name: minWidth

properties.comment: The Y coordinate of the content or window.
properties.name: top

properties.comment: The width of the content or window.
properties.name: width

properties.comment:
If true, the window will stay above most other windows. If there are multiple windows of this kind, the currently focused window will be in the foreground. Requires the alwaysOnTopWindows permission. Defaults to false.

Call setAlwaysOnTop() on the window to change this property after creation.
properties.name: alwaysOnTop

properties.comment: Size and position of the content in the window (excluding the titlebar). If an id is also specified and a window with a matching id has been shown before, the remembered bounds of the window will be used instead.
properties.name: bounds

properties.comment: If true, the window will be focused when created. Defaults to true.
properties.name: focused

properties.comment:
Frame type: none or chrome (defaults to chrome). For none, the -webkit-app-region CSS property can be used to apply draggability to the app's window. -webkit-app-region: drag can be used to mark regions draggable. no-drag can be used to disable this style on nested elements.

Use of FrameOptions is new in M36.
properties.name: frame

properties.comment: If true, the window will be created in a hidden state. Call show() on the window to show it once it has been created. Defaults to false.
properties.name: hidden

properties.comment: URL of the window icon. A window can have its own icon when showInShelf is set to true. The URL should be a global or an extension local URL.
properties.name: icon

properties.comment: Id to identify the window. This will be used to remember the size and position of the window and restore that geometry when a window with the same id is later opened. If a window with a given id is created while another window with the same id already exists, the currently opened window will be focused instead of creating a new window.
properties.name: id

properties.comment:
Used to specify the initial position, initial size and constraints of the window's content (excluding window decorations). If an id is also specified and a window with a matching id has been shown before, the remembered bounds will be used instead.

Note that the padding between the inner and outer bounds is determined by the OS. Therefore setting the same bounds property for both the innerBounds and outerBounds will result in an error.

This property is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: innerBounds

properties.comment: Maximum height of the window.
properties.name: maxHeight

properties.comment: Maximum width of the window.
properties.name: maxWidth

properties.comment: Minimum height of the window.
properties.name: minHeight

properties.comment: Minimum width of the window.
properties.name: minWidth

properties.comment:
Used to specify the initial position, initial size and constraints of the window (including window decorations such as the title bar and frame). If an id is also specified and a window with a matching id has been shown before, the remembered bounds will be used instead.

Note that the padding between the inner and outer bounds is determined by the OS. Therefore setting the same bounds property for both the innerBounds and outerBounds will result in an error.

This property is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: outerBounds

properties.comment: If true, the window will be resizable by the user. Defaults to true.
properties.name: resizable

properties.comment: If true, the window will have its own shelf icon. Otherwise the window will be grouped in the shelf with other windows that are associated with the app. Defaults to false. If showInShelf is set to true you need to specify an id for the window.
properties.name: showInShelf

properties.comment: By default if you specify an id for the window, the window will only be created if another window with the same id doesn't already exist. If a window with the same id already exists that window is activated instead. If you do want to create multiple windows with the same id, you can set this property to false.
properties.deprecated: Multiple windows with the same id is no longer supported.
properties.name: singleton

properties.comment: The initial state of the window, allowing it to be created already fullscreen, maximized, or minimized. Defaults to 'normal'.
properties.name: state

properties.comment: Type of window to create.
properties.deprecated: All app windows use the 'shell' window type
properties.name: type

properties.comment: If true, and supported by the platform, the window will be visible on all workspaces.
properties.name: visibleOnAllWorkspaces

properties.comment:
Allows the frame color of the window when active to be set. Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

Frame coloring is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: activeColor

properties.comment:
Allows the frame color to be set. Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

Frame coloring is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: color

properties.comment:
Allows the frame color of the window when inactive to be set differently to the active color. Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

inactiveColor must be used in conjunction with color.

Frame coloring is new in Chrome 36.
properties.name: inactiveColor

properties.comment:
Frame type: none or chrome (defaults to chrome).

For none, the -webkit-app-region CSS property can be used to apply draggability to the app's window.

-webkit-app-region: drag can be used to mark regions draggable. no-drag can be used to disable this style on nested elements.
properties.name: type

types.comment: State of a window: normal, fullscreen, maximized, minimized.
types.name: State

types.comment: Specifies the type of window to create.
types.name: WindowType

methods.comment: Whether the current platform supports windows being visible on all workspaces.
methods.name: canSetVisibleOnAllWorkspaces

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment:
Called in the creating window (parent) before the load event is called in the created window (child). The parent can set fields or functions on the child usable from onload. E.g. background.js:

function(createdWindow) { createdWindow.contentWindow.foo = function () { }; };

window.js:

window.onload = function () { foo(); }

methods.comment:
The size and position of a window can be specified in a number of different ways. The most simple option is not specifying anything at all, in which case a default size and platform dependent position will be used.

To set the position, size and constraints of the window, use the innerBounds or outerBounds properties. Inner bounds do not include window decorations. Outer bounds include the window's title bar and frame. Note that the padding between the inner and outer bounds is determined by the OS. Therefore setting the same property for both inner and outer bounds is considered an error (for example, setting both innerBounds.left and outerBounds.left).

To automatically remember the positions of windows you can give them ids. If a window has an id, This id is used to remember the size and position of the window whenever it is moved or resized. This size and position is then used instead of the specified bounds on subsequent opening of a window with the same id. If you need to open a window with an id at a location other than the remembered default, you can create it hidden, move it to the desired location, then show it.
methods.name: create

methods.comment: Returns an AppWindow object for the current script context (ie JavaScript 'window' object). This can also be called on a handle to a script context for another page, for example: otherWindow.chrome.app.window.current().
methods.name: current

methods.comment: Gets an AppWindow with the given id. If no window with the given id exists null is returned. This method is new in Chrome 33.
methods.name: get

methods.comment: Gets an array of all currently created app windows. This method is new in Chrome 33.
methods.name: getAll

events.comment: Fired when the window is resized.
events.name: onBoundsChanged

events.comment: Fired when the window is closed. Note, this should be listened to from a window other than the window being closed, for example from the background page. This is because the window being closed will be in the process of being torn down when the event is fired, which means not all APIs in the window's script context will be functional.
events.name: onClosed

events.comment: Fired when the window is fullscreened (either via the AppWindow or HTML5 APIs).
events.name: onFullscreened

events.comment: Fired when the window is maximized.
events.name: onMaximized

events.comment: Fired when the window is minimized.
events.name: onMinimized

events.comment: Fired when the window is restored from being minimized or maximized.
events.name: onRestored

name: chrome.audio
comment: The chrome.audio API is provided to allow users to get information about and control the audio devices attached to the system. This API is currently only available in kiosk mode for ChromeOS.

properties.comment: Device name.
properties.name: deviceName

properties.comment: Type of the device.
properties.name: deviceType

properties.comment: The user-friendly name (e.g. "USB Microphone").
properties.name: displayName

properties.comment: The unique identifier of the audio device.
properties.name: id

properties.comment: True if this is the current active device.
properties.name: isActive

properties.comment: The sound level of the device, volume for output, gain for input.
properties.name: level

properties.comment: The stable/persisted device id string when available.
properties.name: stableDeviceId

properties.comment: Stream type associated with this device.
properties.name: streamType

properties.comment: If set, only audio devices whose active state matches this value will satisfy the filter.
properties.name: isActive

properties.comment: If set, only audio devices whose stream type is included in this list will satisfy the filter.
properties.name: streamTypes

properties.comment:
List of input devices specified by their ID.

To indicate input devices should be unaffected, leave this property unset.
properties.name: input

properties.comment:
List of output devices specified by their ID.

To indicate output devices should be unaffected, leave this property unset.
properties.name: output

properties.comment:
The audio device's desired sound level. Defaults to the device's current sound level.

If used with audio input device, represents audio device gain.

If used with audio output device, represents audio device volume.
properties.name: level

properties.comment: ID of device whose sound level has changed.
properties.name: deviceId

properties.comment: The device's new sound level.
properties.name: level

Specifies IDs of devices that should be active. If either the input or output list is not set, devices in that category are unaffected.

name: chrome.automation
comment: The chrome.automation API allows developers to access the automation (accessibility) tree for the browser. The tree resembles the DOM tree, but only exposes the semantic structure of a page. It can be used to programmatically interact with a page by examining names, roles, and states, listening for events, and performing actions on nodes.

properties.comment:
Gets the first node in this node's subtree which matches the given CSS selector and is within the same DOM context.

If this node doesn't correspond directly with an HTML node in the DOM, querySelector will be run on this node's nearest HTML node ancestor. Note that this may result in the query returning a node which is not a descendant of this node.

If the selector matches a node which doesn't directly correspond to an automation node (for example an element within an ARIA widget, where the ARIA widget forms one node of the automation tree, or an element which is hidden from accessibility via hiding it using CSS or using aria-hidden), this will return the nearest ancestor which does correspond to an automation node.

(2) Node at the end of a paragraph but the start of the node's sentences is in its previous node. Such a node has one more end index. For example, <p><b>Hello</b> world.</p> has two nodes. Returns a tree with a placeholder root node; listen for the "loadComplete" event to get a notification that the tree has fully loaded (the previous root node reference will stop working at or before this point).
methods.name: getTree

parameters.name: observer
parameters.comment: A listener for changes on the AutomationNode tree.

methods.comment: Remove a tree change observer.
methods.name: removeTreeChangeObserver

methods.comment: Sets the selection in a tree. This creates a selection in a single tree (anchorObject and focusObject must have the same root). Everything in the tree between the two node/offset pairs gets included in the selection. The anchor is where the user started the selection, while the focus is the point at which the selection gets extended e.g. when dragging with a mouse or using the keyboard. For nodes with the role staticText, the offset gives the character offset within the value where the selection starts or ends, respectively.
methods.name: setDocumentSelection

name: chrome.bluetooth
comment: Use the chrome.bluetooth API to connect to a Bluetooth device. All functions report failures via chrome.runtime.lastError.

methods.comment:
Start discovery. Newly discovered devices will be returned via the onDeviceAdded event. Previously discovered devices already known to the adapter must be obtained using getDevices and will only be updated using the |onDeviceChanged| event if information about them changes.

Discovery will fail to start if this application has already called startDiscovery. Discovery can be resource intensive: stopDiscovery should be called as soon as possible.

parameters.name: callback

name: chrome.bluetoothLowEnergy
comment: The chrome.bluetoothLowEnergy API is used to communicate with Bluetooth Smart (Low Energy) devices using the Generic Attribute Profile (GATT).

properties.comment: List of manufacturer specific data to be included in "Manufacturer Specific Data" fields of the advertising data.

properties.comment: List of service data to be included in "Service Data" fields of the advertising data.
properties.name: serviceData

properties.comment: List of UUIDs to include in the "Service UUIDs" field of the Advertising Data. These UUIDs can be of the 16bit, 32bit or 128 formats.
properties.name: serviceUuids

properties.comment: List of UUIDs to include in the "Solicit UUIDs" field of the Advertising Data. These UUIDs can be of the 16bit, 32bit or 128 formats.
properties.name: solicitUuids

properties.comment: Type of advertisement.
properties.name: type

properties.comment: Returns the identifier assigned to this characteristic. Use the instance ID to distinguish between characteristics from a peripheral with the same UUID and to make function calls that take in a characteristic identifier. Present, if this instance represents a remote characteristic.

properties.comment: The properties of this characteristic.

properties.comment: The GATT service this characteristic belongs to.
properties.name: service

properties.comment: The UUID of the characteristic, e.g. 00002a37-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb.
properties.name: uuid

properties.comment: The currently cached characteristic value. This value gets updated when the value of the characteristic is read or updated via a notification or indication.
properties.name: value

properties.comment: Flag indicating whether a connection to the device is left open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is false.
properties.name: persistent

properties.comment: The GATT characteristic this descriptor belongs to.
properties.name: characteristic

properties.comment: Returns the identifier assigned to this descriptor. Use the instance ID to distinguish between descriptors from a peripheral with the same UUID and to make function calls that take in a descriptor identifier. Present, if this instance represents a remote characteristic.
properties.name: instanceId

properties.comment: The permissions of this descriptor.
properties.name: permissions

properties.comment: The UUID of the characteristic descriptor, e.g. 00002902-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb.
properties.name: uuid

properties.comment: The currently cached descriptor value. This value gets updated when the value of the descriptor is read.
properties.name: value

properties.comment: The address of the device, in the format 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX'.
properties.name: address

properties.comment: The class of the device, a bit-field defined by http://www.bluetooth.org/en-us/specification/assigned-numbers/baseband.
properties.name: deviceClass

properties.comment: The human-readable name of the device.
properties.name: name

properties.comment: Optional flag for sending an indication instead of a notification.
properties.name: shouldIndicate

properties.comment: New value of the characteristic.
properties.name: value

properties.comment: Flag indicating whether the app should receive notifications when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is false.
properties.name: persistent

properties.comment: Device that send this request.
properties.name: device

properties.comment: Unique ID for this request. Use this ID when responding to this request.
properties.name: requestId

properties.comment: Value to write (if this is a write request).
properties.name: value

properties.comment: If this is an error response, this should be true.
properties.name: isError

properties.comment: Id of the request this is a response to.
properties.name: requestId

properties.comment: Response value. Write requests and error responses will ignore this parameter.
properties.name: value

properties.comment: The device address of the remote peripheral that the GATT service belongs to. Present, if this instance represents a remote service.
properties.name: deviceAddress

properties.comment: Returns the identifier assigned to this service. Use the instance ID to distinguish between services from a peripheral with the same UUID and to make function calls that take in a service identifier. Present, if this instance represents a remote service.
properties.name: instanceId

properties.comment: Indicates whether the type of this service is primary or secondary.
properties.name: isPrimary

properties.comment: The UUID of the service, e.g. 0000180d-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb.
properties.name: uuid

types.comment: Type of advertisement. If 'broadcast' is chosen, the sent advertisement type will be ADV_NONCONN_IND and the device will broadcast with a random MAC Address. If set to 'peripheral', the advertisement type will be ADV_IND or ADV_SCAN_IND and the device will broadcast with real Bluetooth Adapter's MAC Address.
types.name: AdvertisementType

types.comment: Values representing the possible properties of a characteristic. Characteristic permissions are inferred from these properties. Please see the Bluetooth 4.x spec to see the meaning of each individual property.
types.name: CharacteristicProperty

types.comment: Values representing possible permissions for a descriptor. Please see the Bluetooth 4.x spec to see the meaning of each individual permission.
types.name: DescriptorPermission

parameters.name: deviceAddress
parameters.comment: The Bluetooth address of the remote device to which a GATT connection should be opened.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.comment: Connection properties (optional).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Called when the connect request has completed.

methods.comment: Establishes a connection between the application and the device with the given address. A device may be already connected and its GATT services available without calling connect, however, an app that wants to access GATT services of a device should call this function to make sure that a connection to the device is maintained. If the device is not connected, all GATT services of the device will be discovered after a successful call to connect.
methods.name: connect

parameters.name: characteristic
parameters.comment: The characteristic to create.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.comment: ID of the service to create this characteristic for.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Called with the created characteristic's unique ID.

methods.comment: Create a locally hosted GATT characteristic. This characteristic must be hosted under a valid service. If the service ID is not valid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
methods.name: createCharacteristic

parameters.name: descriptor
parameters.comment: The descriptor to create.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.comment: ID of the characteristic to create this descriptor for.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Called with the created descriptor's unique ID.

This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
methods.name: createDescriptor

parameters.name: service
parameters.comment: The service to create.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Called with the created services's unique ID.

methods.comment: Create a locally hosted GATT service. This service can be registered to be available on a local GATT server. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
methods.name: createService

methods.comment:
Get all the GATT services that were discovered on the remote device with the given device address.

Note: If service discovery is not yet complete on the device, this API will return a subset (possibly empty) of services. A work around is to add a time based delay and/or call repeatedly until the expected number of services is returned.

Note, the characteristic needs to correctly set the 'notify' or 'indicate' property during creation for this call to succeed. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

methods.comment: Create an advertisement and register it for advertising. To call this function, the app must have the bluetooth:low_energy and bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. Additionally this API is only available to auto launched apps in Kiosk Mode or by setting the '--enable-ble-advertising-in-apps' command-line switch. See https://developer.chrome.com/apps/manifest/bluetooth Note: On some hardware, central and peripheral modes at the same time is supported but on hardware that doesn't support this, making this call will switch the device to peripheral mode. In the case of hardware which does not support both central and peripheral mode, attempting to use the device in both modes will lead to undefined behavior or prevent other central-role applications from behaving correctly (including the discovery of Bluetooth Low Energy devices).
methods.name: registerAdvertisement

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.comment: Unique ID of a created service.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Callback with the result of the register operation.

methods.comment: Register the given service with the local GATT server. If the service ID is invalid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
methods.name: registerService

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.comment: Unique ID of a current registered service.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Callback called once the service is removed.

methods.comment: Remove the specified service, unregistering it if it was registered. If the service ID is invalid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
methods.name: removeService

parameters.name: minInterval
parameters.comment: Minimum interval between advertisments (in milliseconds). This cannot be lower than 20ms (as per the spec).

parameters.name: maxInterval
parameters.comment: Maximum interval between advertisments (in milliseconds). This cannot be more than 10240ms (as per the spec).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Called once the interval has been set.

methods.comment: Set's the interval betweeen two consecutive advertisements. Note: This is a best effort. The actual interval may vary non-trivially from the requested intervals. On some hardware, there is a minimum interval of 100ms. The minimum and maximum values cannot exceed the the range allowed by the Bluetooth 4.2 specification.
methods.name: setAdvertisingInterval

methods.comment: Disable value notifications/indications from the specified characteristic. After a successful call, the application will stop receiving notifications/indications from this characteristic.

methods.comment: Unregisters an advertisement and stops its advertising. If the advertisement fails to unregister the only way to stop advertising might be to restart the device.

Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: characteristic
parameters.comment: The GATT characteristic whose value has changed.

parameters.name: request
parameters.comment: Request data for this request.

events.comment: Fired when a connected central device requests to write the value of a characteristic registered on the local GATT server. Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
events.name: onCharacteristicWriteRequest

parameters.name: request

Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.
events.name: onDescriptorWriteRequest

name: chrome.bluetoothSocket
comment: Use the chrome.bluetoothSocket API to send and receive data to Bluetooth devices using RFCOMM and L2CAP connections.

properties.comment: An error code indicating what went wrong.

properties.comment: The server socket identifier.
properties.name: socketId

properties.comment: The client socket identifier, i.e. the socket identifier of the newly established connection. This socket identifier should be used only with functions from the chrome.bluetoothSocket namespace. Note the client socket is initially paused and must be explictly un-paused by the application to start receiving data.
properties.name: clientSocketId

properties.comment: The server socket identifier.
properties.name: socketId

properties.comment: The ID of the newly created socket. Note that socket IDs created from this API are not compatible with socket IDs created from other APIs, such as the sockets.tcp API.

properties.name: channel

properties.comment: The L2CAP PSM used by listenUsingL2cap. If specified, this PSM must not be previously in use or the method call with fail. When not specified, an unused PSM will be automatically allocated.
properties.name: psm

properties.comment: An error code indicating what went wrong.
properties.name: error

properties.comment: The error message.

properties.comment: The socket identifier.

properties.name: address

properties.name: bufferSize

properties.comment: Flag indicating whether the socket is connected to a remote peer.
properties.name: connected

properties.comment: Application-defined string associated with the socket.
properties.name: name

properties.comment: Flag indicating whether a connected socket blocks its peer from sending more data, or whether connection requests on a listening socket are dispatched through the onAccept event or queued up in the listen queue backlog. See setPaused. The default value is "false".

properties.comment: Flag indicating if the socket remains open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see SocketProperties.persistent). The default value is "false".
properties.name: persistent

properties.comment: The socket identifier.
properties.name: socketId

properties.comment: If the underlying socket is connected, contains information about the service UUID it is connected to, otherwise if the underlying socket is listening, contains information about the service UUID it is listening on.
properties.name: uuid

properties.comment: The size of the buffer used to receive data. The default value is 4096.
properties.name: bufferSize

properties.comment: An application-defined string associated with the socket.
properties.name: name

properties.comment: Flag indicating whether the socket is left open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is false. When the application is loaded, any sockets previously opened with persistent=true can be fetched with $ref:getSockets.
properties.name: persistent

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Callback from the setPaused method.

methods.comment: Enables or disables a connected socket from receiving messages from its peer, or a listening socket from accepting new connections. The default value is "false". Pausing a connected socket is typically used by an application to throttle data sent by its peer. When a connected socket is paused, no onReceiveevent is raised. When a socket is connected and un-paused, onReceive events are raised again when messages are received. When a listening socket is paused, new connections are accepted until its backlog is full then additional connection requests are refused. onAccept events are raised only when the socket is un-paused.
methods.name: setPaused

If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then an image with size scale * n is selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'

name: chrome.cast.channel
comment: API for communicating with a Google Cast device over an authenticated channel.

properties.comment: Whether the channel is audio only as identified by the device certificate during channel authentication.
properties.name: audioOnly

properties.comment: Id for the channel.
properties.name: channelId

properties.comment: Connection information that was used to establish the channel to the receiver.
properties.name: connectInfo

properties.comment: If set, the last error condition encountered by the channel.
properties.name: errorState

properties.comment: If true, keep-alive messages are handled automatically by the channel.
properties.name: keepAlive

properties.comment: The current state of the channel.
properties.name: readyState

properties.comment: The authentication method required for the channel.
properties.name: auth

properties.comment: If set, CastDeviceCapability bitmask values describing capability of the cast device.
properties.name: capabilities

properties.comment: The IPV4 address of the Cast receiver, e.g. '198.1.0.2'. TODO(mfoltz): Investigate whether IPV6 addresses "just work."
properties.name: ipAddress

properties.comment: The maximum amount of idle time allowed before a channel is closed.
properties.name: livenessTimeout

properties.comment: The amount of time to wait in milliseconds before sending pings to idle channels.
properties.name: pingInterval

properties.comment: The port number to connect to, 0-65535.
properties.name: port

properties.comment: The amount of time to wait in milliseconds before stopping the connection process. Timeouts are disabled if the value is zero. The default timeout is 8000ms.
properties.name: timeout

properties.comment: An error encountered when processing the authentication handshake. Values are defined in the enum ChallengeReplyErrorType in logging.proto.
properties.name: challengeReplyErrorType

properties.comment: The type of error encountered by the channel.
properties.name: errorState

properties.comment: The event that was occurring when the error happened. Values are defined in the enum EventType in logging.proto.
properties.name: eventType

properties.comment: A return value from the underlying net:: socket libraries. Values are defined in net/base/net_error_list.h.
properties.name: netReturnValue

properties.comment: An error code returned by NSS. Values are defined in secerr.h.
properties.name: nssErrorCode

properties.comment: The content of the message. Must be either a string or an ArrayBuffer.
properties.name: data

properties.comment: The message namespace. A namespace is a URN of the form urn:cast-x: that is used to interpret and route Cast messages.
properties.name: namespace_

properties.comment:
source and destination ids identify the origin and destination of the message. They are used to route messages between endpoints that share a device-to-device channel.

For messages between applications: - The sender application id is a unique identifier generated on behalf of the sender application. - The receiver id is always the the session id for the application.

For messages to or from the sender or receiver platform, the special ids 'sender-0' and 'receiver-0' can be used.

For messages intended for all endpoints using a given channel, the wildcard destination_id '*' can be used.
properties.name: sourceId

types.comment: Authentication methods that may be required to connect to a Cast receiver.
types.name: ChannelAuthType

types.comment: Error conditions that the channel may encounter. All error conditions are terminal. When an error condition is encountered the API will: (1) Transition the channel to readyState == 'closed'. (2) Set ChannelInfo.lastError to the error condition. (3) Fire an onError event with the error condition. (4) Fire an onClose event.
types.name: ChannelError

types.comment: The state of the channel.
types.name: ReadyState

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Callback holding the result of a channel operation.

methods.comment: Requests that the channel be closed and invokes callback with the resulting channel status. The channel must be in readyState == 'open' or 'connecting'. If successful, onClose will be fired with readyState == 'closed'. If unsuccessful, channel.readyState will be set to 'closed', and channel.errorState will be set to the error condition.
methods.name: close

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Callback holding the result of a channel operation.

methods.comment: Opens a new channel to the Cast receiver specified by connectInfo. Only one channel may be connected to same receiver from the same extension at a time. If the open request is successful, the callback will be invoked with a ChannelInfo with readyState == 'connecting'. If unsuccessful, the callback will be invoked with a ChannelInfo with channel.readyState == 'closed', channel.errorState will be set to the error condition, and onError will be fired with error details.
methods.name: open

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Callback holding the result of a channel operation.

methods.comment: Sends a message on the channel and invokes callback with the resulting channel status. The channel must be in readyState == 'open'. If unsuccessful, channel.readyState will be set to 'closed', channel.errorState will be set to the error condition, and onError will be fired with error details.
methods.name: send

events.comment: Fired when an error occurs as a result of a channel operation or a network event. |error| contains details of the error.
events.name: onError

events.comment: Fired when a message is received on an open channel.
events.name: onMessage

The array must contain the DER encoding of the X.509 client certificate as its first element.

Chrome is not expected to enforce this, instead stopPinRequest should be called by the extension with errorType = MAX_ATTEMPTS_EXCEEDED when the number of pin requests is exceeded.

properties.comment: Refers to the hash algorithm that was used to create digest.
properties.name: hash

properties.comment: The unique ID to be used by the extension should it need to call a method that requires it, e.g. requestPin.
properties.name: signRequestId

properties.comment: Signature algorithm to be used.
properties.name: algorithm

properties.comment: The DER encoding of a X.509 certificate. The extension must sign input using the associated private key.
properties.name: certificate

properties.comment: Data to be signed. Note that the data is not hashed.

properties.comment: Request identifier to be passed to reportSignature.

properties.comment: The ID given by Chrome in SignRequest.

methods.comment:
Should be called as a response to onSignatureRequested.

The extension must eventually call this function for every onSignatureRequested event; the API implementation will stop waiting for this call after some time and respond with a timeout error when this function is called.
methods.name: reportSignature

parameters.name: details
parameters.comment: Contains the details about the requested dialog.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Is called when the dialog is resolved with the user input, or when the dialog request finishes unsuccessfully (e.g. the dialog was canceled by the user or was not allowed to be shown).

methods.comment: Requests the PIN from the user. Only one ongoing request at a time is allowed. The requests issued while another flow is ongoing are rejected. It's the extension's responsibility to try again later if another flow is in progress.
methods.name: requestPin

parameters.name: details
parameters.comment: The certificates to set. Invalid certificates will be ignored.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: Called upon completion.

methods.comment:
Sets a list of certificates to use in the browser.

The extension should call this function after initialization and on every change in the set of currently available certificates. The extension should also call this function in response to onCertificatesUpdateRequested every time this event is received.
methods.name: setCertificates

parameters.name: details
parameters.comment: Contains the details about the reason for stopping the request flow.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.comment: To be used by Chrome to send to the extension the status from their request to close PIN dialog for user.

methods.comment: Stops the pin request started by the requestPin function.
methods.name: stopPinRequest

events.comment: This event fires every time the browser requests the current list of certificates provided by this extension. The extension must call reportCallback exactly once with the current list of certificates.
events.name: onCertificatesRequested

events.comment: This event fires if the certificates set via setCertificates are insufficient or the browser requests updated information. The extension must call setCertificates with the updated list of certificates and the received certificatesRequestId.
events.name: onCertificatesUpdateRequested

parameters.name: request
parameters.comment: Contains the details about the sign request.

events.comment: This event fires every time the browser needs to sign a message using a certificate provided by this extension in reply to an onCertificatesRequested event. The extension must sign the data in request using the appropriate algorithm and private key and return it by calling reportCallback. reportCallback must be called exactly once.
events.name: onSignDigestRequested

events.comment:
This event fires every time the browser needs to sign a message using a certificate provided by this extension via setCertificates.

The extension must sign the input data from request using the appropriate algorithm and private key and return it by calling reportSignature with the received signRequestId.
events.name: onSignatureRequested

name: chrome.commands

name: chrome.contentScripts
comment: Stub namespace for the "content_scripts" manifest key.

properties.comment: If specified true, it will inject into all frames, even if the frame is not the top-most frame in the tab. Each frame is checked independently for URL requirements; it will not inject into child frames if the URL requirements are not met. Defaults to false, meaning that only the top frame is matched.
properties.name: all_frames

properties.comment: The list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array, before any DOM is constructed or displayed for the page.
properties.name: css

properties.comment: Applied after matches to exclude URLs that match this glob. Intended to emulate the @exclude Greasemonkey keyword.
properties.name: exclude_globs

properties.comment: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings.
properties.name: exclude_matches

properties.comment: Applied after matches to include only those URLs that also match this glob. Intended to emulate the @include Greasemonkey keyword.
properties.name: include_globs

properties.comment: The list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.
properties.name: js

properties.comment: Whether the script should inject into an about:blank frame where the parent or opener frame matches one of the patterns declared in matches. Defaults to false.

properties.comment: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings.
properties.name: matches

properties.comment: Specifies when JavaScript files are injected into the web page. The preferred and default value is document_idle.
properties.name: run_at

types.name: RunAt

name: chrome.contentSettings
comment: Use the chrome.contentSettings API to change settings that control whether websites can use features such as cookies, JavaScript, and plugins. More generally speaking, content settings allow you to customize Chrome's behavior on a per-site basis instead of globally.

properties.comment: Where to clear the setting (default: regular).

properties.comment: The secondary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Defaults to the primary URL. Note that the meaning of a secondary URL depends on the content type, and not all content types use secondary URLs.

properties.comment: The resource identifier for the content type.

properties.comment: Where to set the setting (default: regular).

properties.comment: The pattern for the secondary URL. Defaults to matching all URLs. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

types.name: ResourceIdentifier

types.comment:
The scope of the ContentSetting. One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular settings).
types.name: Scope

properties.comment:
Whether to allow sites to download multiple files automatically. One of
allow: Allow sites to download multiple files automatically,
block: Don't allow sites to download multiple files automatically,
ask: Ask when a site wants to download files automatically after the first file.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.
properties.name: automaticDownloads

properties.comment:
Whether to allow sites to access the camera. One of
allow: Allow sites to access the camera,
block: Don't allow sites to access the camera,
ask: Ask when a site wants to access the camera.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested camera access. The secondary URL is not used.
NOTE: The 'allow' setting is not valid if both patterns are ''.
properties.name: camera

properties.comment:
Whether to allow cookies and other local data to be set by websites. One of
allow: Accept cookies,
block: Block cookies,
session_only: Accept cookies only for the current session.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL representing the cookie origin. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame.
properties.name: cookies

properties.comment: Deprecated. No longer has any effect. Fullscreen permission is now automatically granted for all sites. Value is always allow.
properties.name: fullscreen

properties.comment:
Whether to show images. One of
allow: Show images,
block: Don't show images.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is the URL of the image.
properties.name: images

properties.comment:
Whether to run JavaScript. One of
allow: Run JavaScript,
block: Don't run JavaScript.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.
properties.name: javascript

properties.comment:
Whether to allow Geolocation. One of
allow: Allow sites to track your physical location,
block: Don't allow sites to track your physical location,
ask: Ask before allowing sites to track your physical location.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested location data. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame (which may or may not differ from the requesting URL).
properties.name: location

properties.comment:
Whether to allow sites to access the microphone. One of
allow: Allow sites to access the microphone,
block: Don't allow sites to access the microphone,
ask: Ask when a site wants to access the microphone.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested microphone access. The secondary URL is not used.
NOTE: The 'allow' setting is not valid if both patterns are ''.
properties.name: microphone

properties.comment: Deprecated. No longer has any effect. Mouse lock permission is now automatically granted for all sites. Value is always allow.
properties.name: mouselock

properties.comment:
Whether to allow sites to show desktop notifications. One of
allow: Allow sites to show desktop notifications,
block: Don't allow sites to show desktop notifications,
ask: Ask when a site wants to show desktop notifications.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which wants to show the notification. The secondary URL is not used.
properties.name: notifications

properties.comment:
Whether to run plugins. One of
allow: Run plugins automatically,
block: Don't run plugins automatically,
detect_important_content: Only run automatically those plugins that are detected as the website's main content.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.
properties.name: plugins

properties.comment:
Whether to allow sites to show pop-ups. One of
allow: Allow sites to show pop-ups,
block: Don't allow sites to show pop-ups.
Default is block.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.
properties.name: popups

properties.comment:
Whether to allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed. One of
allow: Allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed,
block: Don't allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed,
ask: Ask when a site wants to run a plugin unsandboxed.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.
properties.name: unsandboxedPlugins

name: chrome.contextMenus
comment: Use the chrome.contextMenus API to add items to Google Chrome's context menu. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

types.comment: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts except for 'launcher'. The 'launcher' context is only supported by apps and is used to add menu items to the context menu that appears when clicking the app icon in the launcher/taskbar/dock/etc. Different platforms might put limitations on what is actually supported in a launcher context menu.

properties.comment: The maximum number of top level extension items that can be added to an extension action context menu. Any items beyond this limit will be ignored.

properties.comment: The initial state of a checkbox or radio button: true for selected, false for unselected. Only one radio button can be selected at a time in a given group.

properties.comment: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'].

properties.comment: The text to display in the item; this is required unless type is separator. When the context is selection, use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

comment: Use the chrome.cookies API to query and modify cookies, and to be notified when they change.

types.comment: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change. If a cookie was inserted, or removed via an explicit call to "chrome.cookies.remove", "cause" will be "explicit". If a cookie was automatically removed due to expiry, "cause" will be "expired". If a cookie was removed due to being overwritten with an already-expired expiration date, "cause" will be set to "expired_overwrite". If a cookie was automatically removed due to garbage collection, "cause" will be "evicted". If a cookie was automatically removed due to a "set" call that overwrote it, "cause" will be "overwrite". Plan your response accordingly.
types.name: OnChangedCause

types.comment: A cookie's 'SameSite' state (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-first-party-cookies). 'no_restriction' corresponds to a cookie set with 'SameSite=None', 'lax' to 'SameSite=Lax', and 'strict' to 'SameSite=Strict'. 'unspecified' corresponds to a cookie set without the SameSite attribute.
types.name: SameSiteStatus

As a special case, note that updating a cookie's properties is implemented as a two step process: the cookie to be updated is first removed entirely, generating a notification with "cause" of "overwrite" . Afterwards, a new cookie is written with the updated values, generating a second notification with "cause" "explicit".

name: chrome.declarativeContent
comment: Use the chrome.declarativeContent API to take actions depending on the content of a page, without requiring permission to read the page's content.

properties.comment: Matches if all of the CSS selectors in the array match displayed elements in a frame with the same origin as the page's main frame. All selectors in this array must be compound selectors to speed up matching. Note: Listing hundreds of CSS selectors or listing CSS selectors that match hundreds of times per page can slow down web sites.

Declarative event action that injects a content script.

WARNING: This action is still experimental and is not supported on stable builds of Chrome.
types.name: RequestContentScript

properties.comment: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing an icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the image used is chosen depending on the screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then an image with size scale * n is selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that details.imageData = foo is equivalent to details.imageData = {'16': foo}.
properties.name: imageData

types.comment:
Declarative event action that sets the n-dip square icon for the extension's page action or browser action while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions, but the extension must have a page or browser action.

Exactly one of imageData or path must be specified. Both are dictionaries mapping a number of pixels to an image representation. The image representation in imageData is an ImageData object; for example, from a canvas element, while the image representation in path is the path to an image file relative to the extension's manifest. If scale screen pixels fit into a device-independent pixel, the scale * n icon is used. If that scale is missing, another image is resized to the required size.
types.name: SetIcon

types.comment: Declarative event action that shows the extension's page action while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions, but the extension must have a page action. If the extension has the activeTab permission, clicking the page action grants access to the active tab.

Within regexSubstitution, backslash-escaped digits (\1 to \9) can be used to insert the corresponding capture groups. \0 refers to the entire matching text.

properties.comment: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

properties.comment: The type of action to perform.
properties.name: type

properties.comment: Specifies whether the network request is first-party or third-party to the domain from which it originated. If omitted, all requests are accepted.
properties.name: domainType

properties.comment:
The rule will only match network requests originating from the list of domains. If the list is omitted, the rule is applied to requests from all domains. An empty list is not allowed.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • This matches against the request initiator and not the request url.
properties.name: domains

properties.comment:
The rule will not match network requests originating from the list of excludedDomains. If the list is empty or omitted, no domains are excluded. This takes precedence over domains.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • This matches against the request initiator and not the request url.
properties.name: excludedDomains

properties.comment: List of resource types which the rule won't match. Only one of resourceTypes and excludedResourceTypes should be specified. If neither of them is specified, all resource types except "main_frame" are blocked.
properties.name: excludedResourceTypes

properties.comment: Whether the urlFilter or regexFilter (whichever is specified) is case sensitive. Default is true.
properties.name: isUrlFilterCaseSensitive

properties.comment:
Regular expression to match against the network request url. This follows the RE2 syntax.

Note: Only one of urlFilter or regexFilter can be specified.

Note: The regexFilter must be composed of only ASCII characters. This is matched against a url where the host is encoded in the punycode format (in case of internationalized domains) and any other non-ascii characters are url encoded in utf-8.
properties.name: regexFilter

properties.comment:
List of resource types which the rule can match. An empty list is not allowed.

Note: this must be specified for allowAllRequests rules and may only include the sub_frame and main_frame resource types.
properties.name: resourceTypes

properties.comment:
The pattern which is matched against the network request url. Supported constructs:

'*' : Wildcard: Matches any number of characters.

'|' : Left/right anchor: If used at either end of the pattern, specifies the beginning/end of the url respectively.

'||' : Domain name anchor: If used at the beginning of the pattern, specifies the start of a (sub-)domain of the URL.

'^' : Separator character: This matches anything except a letter, a digit or one of the following: _ - . %. This can also match the end of the URL.

Therefore urlFilter is composed of the following parts: (optional Left/Domain name anchor) + pattern + (optional Right anchor).

If omitted, all urls are matched. An empty string is not allowed.

A pattern beginning with ||* is not allowed. Use * instead.

Note: Only one of urlFilter or regexFilter can be specified.

Note: The urlFilter must be composed of only ASCII characters. This is matched against a url where the host is encoded in the punycode format (in case of internationalized domains) and any other non-ascii characters are url encoded in utf-8. For example, when the request url is http://abc.?q=, the urlFilter will be matched against the url http://abc.xn--p1ai/?q=%D1%84.
properties.name: urlFilter

properties.comment: Rules matching the given filter.
properties.name: rulesMatchedInfo

properties.name: username
